Processing (STIP) | Straight-through invoice processing (STIP) Gi « Automates the approval and payment of many routine invoices « Payments can be made against Reserve Lines, at either the Claim or the Exposure level = 3807 | Helper classes Gi ¢ STIP is implemented using State Transition Helper classes ¢ Two helper classes in the base application: * InvoiceAutoApprovalHelper manages automatic approvals * InvoiceAutoPaymentHelper manages automatic payments * To change the criteria for automatic processing, change the implementation of the helper classes v vendormanagement © InvoiceAutoApprovalHelper (3) InvoiceAutoApproveAutoPayPlugin ‘C | InvoiceAutoPaymentHelper © ServiceRequestMetricLimitFinderlmpl | Helper methods Gi Each helper has four required methods: * getRelevantInvoices () returns a list of invoices to be processed + Inthe base application, returns invoices waiting to be approved or paid « For each invoice returned by getRelevant Invoices, getFailedToQualifyReasons () returns a list of reasons why the invoice cannot be processed * performAction() —if getFailedToQualifyReasons () returns an empty list, processes the Invoice * InvoiceAutoApprovalHelper marks the invoice as approved * InvoiceAutoPaymentHelper creates a check and marks the invoice as paid ¢ registerFailure() —if the list of reasons is not empty, creates (or updates) an activity to manually process the invoice + Activity patterns in the base application are INVOICE NOT AUTO APPROVED and INVOICE NOT AUTO PAID + Activity includes the list of reasons not processed | Plugin Gi The helpers are instantiated by a plugin. * The plugin provided in the base configuration is the InvoiceAutoApproveAutoPayPlugin package gw.plugin.vendormanagement uses java-util.bist @Export class InvoiceAuto&pproveAutoPayPlugin implements IInvoiceautoProcessingPlugin { k gu.plugin. vendormanagement. Instance } | STIP in the UI Gi On the Invoices tab, when the user clicks the button to pay an invoice which was not previously approved, ClaimCenter invokes the invoice automatic processor. Turning STIP off ¢ STIP is turned on by default in the base configuration Changing criteria for automatic processing of invoices Changing criteria for which invoices may be automatically processed InvoiceAutoApproveAutoPayPlugin ¢ To turn STIP off, deregister or disable the plugin | 1 nvoiceAutoProcessingPlugin.gwp * | Name: == +E) InvoiceAutoProcessingPlugin| InvoiceAutoProcessingPlugin change the criteria for which invoices will be automatically approved or paid, edit the getFailedToQualifyReasons () method of the relevant helper ¢ Add, edit, or delete clauses of the form if(criterion_for_failure) { failurereasons.add("failure_text") } override protected function getFailedtoqualifyReasons (invoice: SexviceRequest invoice): List ( var serviceRequest = invoice.ServiceRequest var claim = serviceRequest.claim var failureReasons: List = {} if (claim.state == Claimstate.7C_ CLOSED) { failureReasons.add("The Claim is closed") } if (claim.s1ustatus == SIUStatus.7C_UNDER_INVESTIGATION) { failureReasons.add("There is an active SIU investigation") } | Changing the maximum amount that can be Gi auto-approved * InvoiceAutoApprovalHelper has a property that maps currencies to the largest amount that can be automatically approved static property get SmallAmountThresholds(): Map { return { Currency. 7C_CAD -> 600bd, Currency. 7C_USD -> 500bd , } * The last “if clause of getFailedToQualifyReasons in InvoiceAutoApprovalHelper rejects invoices that exceed this amount else if (invoice.Amount.Amount > smallaAmountThreshold) { failureReasons.add("The amount is too high") n ¢ To change the maximum amount that can be auto-approved, modify the SmallAmountThresholds property | Changing criteria for which invoices can be Gi automatically processed To change which invoices are considered for automatic approval or payment, modify the getRelevant Invoices () method of the relevant helper. * The method must return List to be consumed by the getFailedToQualifyReasons method override function getRelevantInvoices (invoices: List): List { return invoices.where(\ invoice -> invoice. IsWaitingForApproval) } | Changing the kinds of processing that are Gi automated To change the kinds of processing automated by STIP, edit the StateTransitionHelpers property of InvoiceAutoApproveAutoPayPlugin. * Comment out one of the existing helpers * Create and add your own helper + NOTE: Do this with extreme caution override property get StateTransitionHelpers(): List { return { InvoiceAutoApprovalHelper. | Review: service request types Gi

* Lifecycle is managed by a state handler specific to the service request type

« Inthe base application, there are four
service request types:

* Quote only Services

| Two important notes Gi

« When you have finished editing and importing vendorservicetree.xml and
vendorservicedetails.xml, you must restart ClaimCenter (and
ContactManager in the case of vendorservicetree. xml) for the changes to
take effect.

¢ Ifyou add a child node to a node whose service type has previously been
assigned to any service providers, then importing vendorservicetree.xml will
cause errors which must be corrected.

se sSeSo SSeS SSeS e ee sSHeS

Configuring Straight-Through
Invoice Processing (STIP)

| Straight-through invoice processing (STIP) Gi

« Automates the approval and payment of many routine invoices

« Payments can be made against Reserve Lines, at either the Claim or the
Exposure level

= 3807

| Helper classes Gi

¢ STIP is implemented using State Transition Helper classes
¢ Two helper classes in the base application:
* InvoiceAutoApprovalHelper manages automatic approvals
* InvoiceAutoPaymentHelper manages automatic payments
* To change the criteria for automatic processing, change the implementation of the
helper classes
v vendormanagement
© InvoiceAutoApprovalHelper
(3) InvoiceAutoApproveAutoPayPlugin

‘C | InvoiceAutoPaymentHelper
© ServiceRequestMetricLimitFinderlmpl

| Helper methods Gi

Each helper has four required methods:

* getRelevantInvoices () returns a list of invoices to be processed
+ Inthe base application, returns invoices waiting to be approved or paid

« For each invoice returned by getRelevant Invoices, getFailedToQualifyReasons ()
returns a list of reasons why the invoice cannot be processed

* performAction() —if getFailedToQualifyReasons () returns an empty list, processes the
Invoice
* InvoiceAutoApprovalHelper marks the invoice as approved
* InvoiceAutoPaymentHelper creates a check and marks the invoice as paid

¢ registerFailure() —if the list of reasons is not empty, creates (or updates) an activity to

manually process the invoice

+ Activity patterns in the base application are INVOICE NOT AUTO APPROVED and
INVOICE NOT AUTO PAID

+ Activity includes the list of reasons not processed

| STIP in the UI Gi

On the Invoices tab, when the user clicks the button to pay an invoice which was not
previously approved, ClaimCenter invokes the invoice automatic processor.

Services

| Details | History | Activities | Documents | Notes | invoices | Messages

By

Invoice Ref# > Attention > Submitted Date > Amount > Status > Description > Check# $ CheckAmount  CheckStatus >

Details

Withdraw

ice waiting for payment

| Processor Gi

« When invoices enter the system, either manually or through an integration, a
“processor” is invoked

* This occurs after any regular Gosu rules are run on the invoice
¢ Runs independently of the bundle which creates the invoice
¢ Any prior work by the user is not affected
¢ Inthe provided implementation, the processor uses each helper as a “checklist”

« Each of a series of potential failure reasons is checked against each invoice associated with
the service request

¢ If none of the failure reasons match the invoice, the action, such as approval or
payment, is automatically performed

| Permissions Gi

The permissions and authority limits of the user who inputs an invoice are used in
determining whether the invoice can be automatically approved and paid.

Adjuster. vp«

Basics Users

Role
Name Adjuster
Description Base permissions for an adjuster

my [>

Permission + Code Description

Close claims claimclose _ Permission to close a claim

Close exposures expclose Permission to close an exposure
Close matters ttrclose Permission to close matters on a claim

Create activities actcreate Permission to create new activities

| Possible configurations to STIP

Turning STIP off
¢ STIP is turned on by default in the base configuration
Changing criteria for automatic processing of invoices
Changing criteria for which invoices may be automatically processed
Changing what kinds of processing are automated

| Turning STIP off

* STIP is implemented using the InvoiceAutoProcessingPlugin

Gi

« In the base application, this is implemented using InvoiceAutoApproveAutoPayPlugin

¢ To turn STIP off, deregister or disable the plugin

| Changing the maximum amount that can be Gi
auto-approved

* InvoiceAutoApprovalHelper has a property that maps currencies to the
largest amount that can be automatically approved

static property get SmallAmountThresholds(): Map<Currency, BigDecimal> {
return {
Currency. 7C_CAD -> 600bd,
Currency. 7C_USD -> 500bd
,
}

* The last “if clause of getFailedToQualifyReasons in
InvoiceAutoApprovalHelper rejects invoices that exceed this amount

else if (invoice.Amount.Amount > smallaAmountThreshold) {
failureReasons.add("The amount is too high")
n

¢ To change the maximum amount that can be auto-approved, modify the
SmallAmountThresholds property

| Changing the kinds of processing that are Gi
automated

To change the kinds of processing automated by STIP, edit the
StateTransitionHelpers property of InvoiceAutoApproveAutoPayPlugin.

* Comment out one of the existing helpers

* Create and add your own helper
+ NOTE: Do this with extreme caution

override property get StateTransitionHelpers(): List<InvoiceAutomaticStateTransitionHelper> {
return {
InvoiceAutoApprovalHelper. Instance,
InvoiceAutoPaymentHelper. Instance
}

Question G

,~ — What do State Transition Helper classes enable?

¢
4

Question G

_~ — 'faninvoice comes into the system through a vendor portal, what
¢ provides the approval limits for STIP?

4
¢

sSesoeooce SSeS Seee5b505

Answer a

,~ — faninvoice comes into the system through a vendor portal, what
¢ provides the approval limits for STIP?

74
¢

The correct answer is:

The web service that accepts the invoice is associated with a user, whose permissions
enable that web service.

The approval limits are those of that user.
